page.title: 10BANCHORY-DEVENICK SCHOOL
page.content: Banchory-Devenick school was built in { 1879}and some of the present pupils' grandparents attended it. Before then there were two church schools in the parish which are now private homes. The school has a kitchen, staff room, three classrooms, five toilets and a cleaning cupboard. The toilets were in the playground but they are now used as stores and "huts". Long ago 100 pupils attended then the numbers dropped badly but are now steady. Now {the roll is between 40 and 50.}There are three class teachers and visiting teachers who specialise in Art, P.E., Home Economics, Music and Drama. There is a lack of space so one classroom has also to be the dining room and gymn hall. The pupils attend from age {5 to 11}then transfer to their parent's choice of Secondary School either in Aberdeen or Stonehaven.
